argumentText:
ARGUMENT
x

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | subrgmvr.v | |- V = ( I mVar R ) |
| 2 |  | subrgmvr.i | |- ( ph -> I e. W ) |
| 3 |  | subrgmvr.r | |- ( ph -> T e. ( SubRing ` R ) ) |
| 4 |  | subrgmvr.h | |- H = ( R |`s T ) |
| 5 |  | subrgmvrf.u | |- U = ( I mPoly H ) |
| 6 |  | subrgmvrf.b | |- B = ( Base ` U ) |
| 7 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( I mPwSer R ) = ( I mPwSer R ) |
| 8 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( Base ` ( I mPwSer R ) ) = ( Base ` ( I mPwSer R ) ) |
| 9 |  | #P_subrgrcl | |- ( T e. ( SubRing ` R ) -> R e. Ring ) |
| 10 | 3, 9 | #P_syl | |- ( ph -> R e. Ring ) |
| 11 | 7, 1, 8, 2, 10 | #P_mvrf | |- ( ph -> V : I --> ( Base ` ( I mPwSer R ) ) ) |
| 12 |  | #P_ffn | |- ( V : I --> ( Base ` ( I mPwSer R ) ) -> V Fn I ) |
| 13 | 11, 12 | #P_syl | |- ( ph -> V Fn I ) |
| 14 | 1, 2, 3, 4 | #P_subrgmvr | |- ( ph -> V = ( I mVar H ) ) |
| 15 | 14 | #P_fveq1d | |- ( ph -> ( V ` x ) = ( ( I mVar H ) ` x ) ) |
| 16 | 15 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. I ) -> ( V ` x ) = ( ( I mVar H ) ` x ) ) |
| 17 |  | #P_eqid | |- ( I mVar H ) = ( I mVar H ) |
| 18 | 2 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. I ) -> I e. W ) |
| 19 | 4 | #P_subrgring | |- ( T e. ( SubRing ` R ) -> H e. Ring ) |
| 20 | 3, 19 | #P_syl | |- ( ph -> H e. Ring ) |
| 21 | 20 | #P_adantr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. I ) -> H e. Ring ) |
| 22 |  | #P_simpr | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. I ) -> x e. I ) |
| 23 | 5, 17, 6, 18, 21, 22 | #P_mvrcl | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. I ) -> ( ( I mVar H ) ` x ) e. B ) |
| 24 | 16, 23 | #P_eqeltrd | |- ( ( ph /\ x e. I ) -> ( V ` x ) e. B ) |
| 25 | 24 | #P_ralrimiva | |- ( ph -> A. x e. I ( V ` x ) e. B ) |
| 26 |  | #P_ffnfv | |- ( V : I --> B <-> ( V Fn I /\ A. x e. I ( V ` x ) e. B ) ) |
| 27 | 13, 25, 26 | #P_sylanbrc | |- ( ph -> V : I --> B ) |
